alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 4:40PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Rivers Rising Rapidly Into This Weekend... Strong thunderstorms brought heavy rain to the Eastern Brooks Range Thursday night. This is now causing high water on rivers draining the Brooks Range, and rivers north of the mountains will continue rising this weekend. Water levels are rising rapidly on the Sag River near Pump Station 3, and are likely rising on other rivers draining the north side of the Eastern Brooks Range. Water will cover gravel bars, and there is a chance of flooding. People in the Eastern Brooks Range should be alert for rising water levels tonight near the Brooks Range, and through the weekend further north of the mountains as the water moves downstream towards the coast.
